AmplitudeEnvelope.description: Trigger the attack/decay portion of the ADSR envelope.

params.description: When the attack should start.
params.name: time

params.description:
The velocity of the envelope scales the vales.
                              number between 0-1
params.name: velocity

examples:
//trigger the attack 0.5 seconds from now with a velocity of 0.2
 env.triggerAttack("+0.5", 0.2);
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: triggerAttack

AmplitudeEnvelope.description: Triggers the release of the envelope.

params.description: When the release portion of the envelope should start.
params.name: time

examples:
//trigger release immediately
 env.triggerRelease();
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: triggerRelease

AmplitudeEnvelope.description:
Get the scheduled value at the given time. This will
 return the unconverted (raw) value.

params.description: The time in seconds.
params.name: time

returns.description: The scheduled value at the given time.

AmplitudeEnvelope.name: getValueAtTime

AmplitudeEnvelope.description:
triggerAttackRelease is shorthand for triggerAttack, then waiting
 some duration, then triggerRelease.

params.description: The duration of the sustain.
params.name: duration

params.description: When the attack should be triggered.
params.name: time

params.description: The velocity of the envelope.
params.name: velocity

examples:
//trigger the attack and then the release after 0.6 seconds.
env.triggerAttackRelease(0.6);
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: triggerAttackRelease

AmplitudeEnvelope.description: Cancels all scheduled envelope changes after the given time.
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: cancel

AmplitudeEnvelope.description: Connect 'this' to the master output. Shorthand for this.connect(Tone.Master)
examples:
//connect an oscillator to the master output
var osc = new Tone.Oscillator().toMaster();
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: toMaster

params.description:
Either the output index to disconnect
                                  if the output is an array, or the
                                  node to disconnect from.
params.name: output

AmplitudeEnvelope.description: Connect the output of this node to the rest of the nodes in series.
examples:
//connect a node to an effect, panVol and then to the master output
 node.chain(effect, panVol, Tone.Master);
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: chain

AmplitudeEnvelope.description: connect the output of this node to the rest of the nodes in parallel.
AmplitudeEnvelope.name: fan

Tone.description:
Generate a buffer by rendering all of the Tone.js code within the callback using the OfflineAudioContext.
 The OfflineAudioContext is capable of rendering much faster than real time in many cases.
 The callback function also passes in an offline instance of Tone.Transport which can be used
 to schedule events along the Transport. **NOTE** OfflineAudioContext has the same restrictions
 as the AudioContext in that on certain platforms (like iOS) it must be invoked by an explicit
 user action like a click or tap.

params.description: All Tone.js nodes which are created and scheduled within this callback are recorded into the output Buffer.
params.name: callback

params.description: the amount of time to record for.
params.name: duration

returns.description: The promise which is invoked with the Tone.Buffer of the recorded output.

Tone.name: Offline

WARNING: if object is self referential, it will go into an an infinite recursive loop.

Transport.description: Schedule an event along the timeline.

params.description: The callback to be invoked at the time.
params.name: callback

params.description: The time to invoke the callback at.
params.name: time

returns.description: The id of the event which can be used for canceling the event.

Transport.name: schedule

Transport.description:
Schedule a repeated event along the timeline. The event will fire
 at the `interval` starting at the `startTime` and for the specified
 `duration`.

params.description: The callback to invoke.
params.name: callback

params.description:
The duration between successive
                              callbacks. Must be a positive number.
params.name: interval

params.description:
When along the timeline the events should
                              start being invoked.
params.name: startTime

params.description: How long the event should repeat.
params.name: duration

examples:
//a callback invoked every eighth note after the first measure
Tone.Transport.scheduleRepeat(callback, "8n", "1m");

returns.description:
The ID of the scheduled event. Use this to cancel
                          the event.

Transport.name: scheduleRepeat

Transport.description:
Schedule an event that will be removed after it is invoked.
 Note that if the given time is less than the current transport time,
 the event will be invoked immediately.

params.description: The callback to invoke once.
params.name: callback

params.description: The time the callback should be invoked.
params.name: time

returns.description: The ID of the scheduled event.

Transport.name: scheduleOnce

Transport.description: Clear the passed in event id from the timeline

params.description: The id of the event.

Tone.Transport.start("+1", "4:0:0");

Tone#Tone.description:
Set the parameters at once. Either pass in an
 object mapping parameters to values, or to set a
 single parameter, by passing in a string and value.
 The last argument is an optional ramp time which
 will ramp any signal values to their destination value
 over the duration of the rampTime.
examples: filter.set("type", "highpass");
Tone#Tone.name: set

Tone#Tone.description:
Get the object's attributes. Given no arguments get
 will return all available object properties and their corresponding
 values. Pass in a single attribute to retrieve or an array
 of attributes. The attribute strings can also include a "."
 to access deeper properties.

params.description:
the parameters to get, otherwise will return
 					                  all available.
params.name: params

examples:
osc.get();
//returns {"type" : "sine", "frequency" : 440, ...etc}

osc.get("type");
//returns { "type" : "sine"}
Tone#Tone.name: get

Tone#Tone.description: Return the current time of the AudioContext clock.
Tone#Tone.name: now

Tone automatically creates a context on init, but if you are working
 with other libraries which also create an AudioContext, it can be
 useful to set your own. If you are going to set your own context,
 be sure to do it at the start of your code, before creating any objects.

params.name: ctx

params.name: resolve

If a value is passed in, the value of the

AMSynth.description: Trigger the attack of the note optionally with a given velocity.

params.description: The note to trigger.
params.name: note

params.description: When the note should start.
params.name: time

params.description:
velocity The velocity scaler 
                               determines how "loud" the note 
                               will be triggered.
params.name: velocity

examples: synth.triggerAttack("C4");

//trigger the note a half second from now at half velocity
synth.triggerAttack("C4", "+0.5", 0.5);
AMSynth.name: triggerAttack

AMSynth.description: Trigger the release portion of the envelope

params.description: If no time is given, the release happens immediatly
params.name: time

examples: synth.triggerRelease();
AMSynth.name: triggerRelease

AMSynth.description:
Get the level of the output at the given time. Measures
 the envelope(s) value at the time.

params.description: The time to query the envelope value
params.name: time

AMSynth.name: getLevelAtTime

AMSynth.description:
Set the note at the given time. If no time is given, the note
 will set immediately.

params.description: The note to change to.
params.name: note

params.description: The time when the note should be set.
params.name: time

examples:
//change to F#6 in one quarter note from now.
synth.setNote("F#6", "+4n");

//change to Bb4 right now
synth.setNote("Bb4");
AMSynth.name: setNote

AMSynth.description:
Sync the instrument to the Transport. All subsequent calls of
[triggerAttack](#triggerattack) and [triggerRelease](#triggerrelease)
will be scheduled along the transport.
examples:
instrument.sync()
//schedule 3 notes when the transport first starts
instrument.triggerAttackRelease('C4', '8n', 0)
instrument.triggerAttackRelease('E4', '8n', '8n')
instrument.triggerAttackRelease('G4', '8n', '4n')
//start the transport to hear the notes
Transport.start()
AMSynth.name: sync

params.description: The note to trigger.

params.description:
How long the note should be held for before

DuoSynth.description: Trigger the attack of the note optionally with a given velocity.

params.description: The note to trigger.

params.description: When the note should start.
params.name: time

velocity The velocity scaler

DuoSynth.description:
Set the note at the given time. If no time is given, the note
 will set immediately.

params.description: The note to change to.
params.name: note

params.description: The time when the note should be set.
params.name: time

examples:
//change to F#6 in one quarter note from now.
synth.setNote("F#6", "+4n");

//change to Bb4 right now
synth.setNote("Bb4");
DuoSynth.name: setNote

DuoSynth.description:
Sync the instrument to the Transport. All subsequent calls of
[triggerAttack](#triggerattack) and [triggerRelease](#triggerrelease)
will be scheduled along the transport.
examples:
instrument.sync()
//schedule 3 notes when the transport first starts
instrument.triggerAttackRelease('C4', '8n', 0)
instrument.triggerAttackRelease('E4', '8n', '8n')
instrument.triggerAttackRelease('G4', '8n', '4n')
//start the transport to hear the notes
Transport.start()

PolySynth.description: Trigger the attack portion of the note

params.description:
The notes to play. Accepts a single
                                 Frequency or an array of frequencies.
params.name: notes

params.description: The start time of the note.
params.name: time

params.description: The velocity of the note.
params.name: velocity

examples:
//trigger a chord immediately with a velocity of 0.2
poly.triggerAttack(["Ab3", "C4", "F5"], undefined, 0.2);
PolySynth.name: triggerAttack

PolySynth.description: Trigger the attack and release after the specified duration

params.description:
The notes to play. Accepts a single
                                 Frequency or an array of frequencies.
params.name: notes

params.description: the duration of the note
params.name: duration

params.description: if no time is given, defaults to now
params.name: time

params.description: the velocity of the attack (0-1)
params.name: velocity

examples:
//trigger a chord for a duration of a half note
poly.triggerAttackRelease(["Eb3", "G4", "C5"], "2n");

//can pass in an array of durations as well
poly.triggerAttackRelease(["Eb3", "G4", "C5"], ["2n", "4n", "4n"]);
PolySynth.name: triggerAttackRelease

PolySynth.description:
Trigger the release of the note. Unlike monophonic instruments,
 a note (or array of notes) needs to be passed in as the first argument.

params.description:
The notes to play. Accepts a single
                                 Frequency or an array of frequencies.
params.name: notes

params.description: When the release will be triggered.
params.name: time

examples: poly.triggerRelease(["Ab3", "C4", "F5"], "+2n");
PolySynth.name: triggerRelease

PolySynth.description:
Sync the instrument to the Transport. All subsequent calls of
[triggerAttack](#triggerattack) and [triggerRelease](#triggerrelease)
will be scheduled along the transport.
examples:
synth.sync()
//schedule 3 notes when the transport first starts
synth.triggerAttackRelease('8n', 0)
synth.triggerAttackRelease('8n', '8n')
synth.triggerAttackRelease('8n', '4n')
//start the transport to hear the notes
Transport.start()

Get the synth's attributes. Given no arguments get
 will return all available object properties and their corresponding
 values. Pass in a single attribute to retrieve or an array
 of attributes. The attribute strings can also include a "."
 to access deeper properties.

the parameters to get, otherwise will return
 					   all available.

Synth.description: Trigger the attack of the note optionally with a given velocity.

params.description: The note to trigger.
params.name: note

params.description: When the note should start.
params.name: time

params.description:
velocity The velocity scaler 
                               determines how "loud" the note 
                               will be triggered.
params.name: velocity

examples: synth.triggerAttack("C4");

//trigger the note a half second from now at half velocity
synth.triggerAttack("C4", "+0.5", 0.5);
Synth.name: triggerAttack

Synth.description: Trigger the release portion of the envelope

params.description: If no time is given, the release happens immediatly

params.name: time

Synth.description:
Set the note at the given time. If no time is given, the note
 will set immediately.

params.description: The note to change to.
params.name: note

params.description: The time when the note should be set.
params.name: time

examples:
//change to F#6 in one quarter note from now.
synth.setNote("F#6", "+4n");

//change to Bb4 right now
synth.setNote("Bb4");
Synth.name: setNote

Synth.description:
Sync the instrument to the Transport. All subsequent calls of
[triggerAttack](#triggerattack) and [triggerRelease](#triggerrelease)
will be scheduled along the transport.
examples:
instrument.sync()
//schedule 3 notes when the transport first starts
instrument.triggerAttackRelease('C4', '8n', 0)
instrument.triggerAttackRelease('E4', '8n', '8n')
instrument.triggerAttackRelease('G4', '8n', '4n')
//start the transport to hear the notes
Transport.start()
Synth.name: sync

Synth.description: Unsync the instrument from the Transport
Synth.name: unsync

Synth.description: Trigger the attack and then the release after the duration.

params.description: The note to trigger.
params.name: note

params.description:
How long the note should be held for before
                         triggering the release. This value must be greater than 0.
params.name: duration

params.description: When the note should be triggered.
params.name: time

params.description: The velocity the note should be triggered at.
params.name: velocity

examples:
//trigger "C4" for the duration of an 8th note
synth.triggerAttackRelease("C4", "8n");
Synth.name: triggerAttackRelease

Noise.description:
Start the source at the specified time. If no time is given,
 start the source now.

params.description: When the source should be started.
params.name: time

examples: source.start("+0.5"); //starts the source 0.5 seconds from now
Noise.name: start

Noise.description:
Stop the source at the specified time. If no time is given,
 stop the source now.

params.description: When the source should be stopped.
params.name: time

examples: source.stop(); // stops the source immediately
Noise.name: stop

Noise.description:
Sync the source to the Transport so that all subsequent
 calls to `start` and `stop` are synced to the TransportTime
 instead of the AudioContext time.
Noise.name: sync

Noise.description: Unsync the source to the Transport. See Tone.Source.sync
Noise.name: unsync

TickSource.description:
Start the clock at the given time. Optionally pass in an offset
 of where to start the tick counter from.

params.description: The time the clock should start
params.name: time

params.description: The number of ticks to start the source at
params.name: offset

TickSource.name: start

TickSource.description: Stop the clock. Stopping the clock resets the tick counter to 0.

params.description: The time when the clock should stop.
params.name: time

examples: clock.stop();
TickSource.name: stop

TickSource.description: Pause the clock. Pausing does not reset the tick counter.

params.description: The time when the clock should stop.
params.name: time

TickSource.name: pause

TickSource.description: Cancel start/stop/pause and setTickAtTime events scheduled after the given time.

params.description: When to clear the events after
params.name: time

TickSource.name: cancel

TickSource.description: Get the elapsed ticks at the given time

params.description: When to get the tick value
params.name: time

TickSource.name: getTicksAtTime

TickSource.description: Return the elapsed seconds at the given time.

params.description: When to get the elapsed seconds
params.name: time

TickSource.name: getSecondsAtTime

TickSource.description: Set the clock's ticks at the given time.

params.description: The tick value to set
params.name: ticks

params.description: When to set the tick value
params.name: time

TickSource.name: setTicksAtTime

TickSource.description: Returns the scheduled state at the given time.

params.description: The time to query.
params.name: time

examples:
source.start("+0.1");
source.getStateAtTime("+0.1"); //returns "started"

returns.description: The name of the state input in setStateAtTime.

TickSource.name: getStateAtTime

TickSource.description:
Get the time of the given tick. The second argument
is when to test before. Since ticks can be set (with setTicksAtTime)
there may be multiple times for a given tick value.

params.description: The tick number.
params.name: ticks

params.description: When to measure the tick value from.
params.name: before

Frequency.description: Transposes the frequency by the given number of semitones.
examples: Tone.Frequency("A4").transpose(3); //"C5"
Frequency.name: transpose

Frequency.description:
Takes an array of semitone intervals and returns
 an array of frequencies transposed by those intervals.
examples: Tone.Frequency("A4").harmonize([0, 3, 7]); //["A4", "C5", "E5"]
Frequency.name: harmonize

Frequency.description: Return the value of the frequency as a MIDI note
examples: Tone.Frequency("C4").toMidi(); //60
Frequency.name: toMidi

Frequency.description: Return the value of the frequency in Scientific Pitch Notation
examples: Tone.Frequency(69, "midi").toNote(); //"A4"
Frequency.name: toNote

Frequency.description: Return the duration of one cycle in seconds.
Frequency.name: toSeconds

Frequency.description: Return the duration of one cycle in ticks
Frequency.name: toTicks

examples: Tone.Frequency.mtof(69); // returns 440

Frequency.description: Convert a frequency value to a MIDI note.

examples: Tone.Frequency.ftom(440); // returns 69
Frequency.name: ftom

Ticks.description:
Quantize the time by the given subdivision. Optionally add a
 percentage which will move the time value towards the ideal
 quantized value by that percentage.

params.description: The subdivision to quantize to
params.name: val

params.description:
Move the time value
                                  towards the quantized value by
                                  a percentage.
params.name: percent

examples:
Tone.Time(21).quantize(2) //returns 22
Tone.Time(0.6).quantize("4n", 0.5) //returns 0.55
Ticks.name: quantize

Ticks.description:
Convert a Time to Notation. The notation values are will be the
 closest representation between 1m to 128th note.
examples:
//if the Transport is at 120bpm:
Tone.Time(2).toNotation();//returns "1m"
Ticks.name: toNotation

Ticks.description: Return the time encoded as Bars:Beats:Sixteenths.

Ticks.description:
Evaluate the time value. Returns the time
 in seconds.
